sen.j: 袿（うちき、うちぎ）は十二単、五衣、等、女性の平安装束を構成する着物の一つであるが、単独で着用する場合もある。
sen.e: Uchiki (also known as "uchigi") is a kind of kimono that is a part of female costume of Heian period, such as, juni-hitoe (twelve-layered ceremonial kimono) and five-layer robe. However, it may be worn by itself.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Uchiki (also known as "uchigi") is a kind of kimono that is worn by women as part of Heian-era costumes, such as the juni-hitoe (twelve-layered ceremonial kimono) and five-layer robe, although it may also be worn by itself.
sen.cmt: Added "worn""a part of female costume of Heian period"→"by women as part of Heian-era costumes"Added "the"
sen.e: Uchiki (also known as "uchigi") is a kind of kimono that is worn by women as part of Heian-period costumes, such as the twelve-layered ceremonial kimono and five-layer robe, although it may also be worn by itself.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 構造は単衣、打衣、表衣と全く変わらない物である。
sen.e: Its design is exactly same as hitoe (single robe), uchiginu (beaten scarlet silk robe worn as a stiffener and support for the outer robes), and uwagi (patterned woven and decorated silk robe than is shorter and narrower than the uchiginu).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Its design is exactly the same as hitoe (single robe), uchiginu (beaten scarlet silk robe worn as a stiffener and support for the outer robes), and uwagi (patterned woven and decorated silk outer robe that is shorter and narrower than the uchiginu).
sen.cmt: Added "the", "outer""than"→"that"
sen.e: Its design is exactly the same as single robe, beaten scarlet silk robe, and patterned woven and decorated silk outer robe.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 調製の違いや、着用箇所の違いで「袿」と呼ばれる。
sen.e: It is called "uchiki" by the difference in manufacture and where to put on.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The only difference is in its manufacture and the order in which it is put on.
sen.cmt: Reworded sentence
sen.e: The only difference is in its adjustment and the order in which it is put on.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 平安時代は裏地を表地側にはみ出すように調製していた（おめり）が、明治時代以降、袿を重ね着しているように見せるために裏地と表地の間に中陪（なかべ）という別の生地を挟み込んで調製するのが慣例となった。
sen.e: In Heian period, omeri (lining cloth was put so that it stick out of outer cloth) was usually made; and after Meiji Period, another cloth called nakabe was inserted between lining and the outer cloth as if uchiki are worn in layers.

In the Heian period, uchiki were worn so that the edges showed between each layer (a style known as omeri) but from the Meiji Period, another cloth called a nakabe was inserted between the inner and outer layers, to make it appear as if the uchiki are worn in layers.
sen.cmt: Reworded sentence for grammar and clarity
sen.e: In the Heian period, uchiki were worn so that the edges showed between each layer (a style known as omeri) but from the Meiji period, another cloth called a nakabe was inserted between the inner and outer layers, to make it appear as if the uchiki are worn in layers.
sen.cmt: スペルを修正。

sen.j: 唐衣等より身体側に着付ける「うちがわのきもの」の略から着たという説や、「打ちかける着物」の略からきたという説がある。
sen.e: There are several theories, such as, that it came from "uchigawa no kimono", which means kimono to be worn inside of karaginu, and "uchikakeru kimono", which means kimono to be worn over another kimono.

Theories include that the name comes from "uchigawa no kimono", which means a kimono to be worn under the karaginu (the outermost layer), or from "uchikakeru kimono", which means a kimono to be worn over another kimono.
sen.cmt: "There are several theories, such as, that it came"→"Theories include that the name comes"Added "a""inside of"→"under"Added "the", "(the outermost layer)""and"→"or from"Added "a"
sen.e: Theories include that the name comes from 'uchigawa no kimono,' which means a kimono to be worn under the karaginu (the outermost layer), or from 'uchikakeru kimono,' which means a kimono to be worn over another kimono.
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合わせ"を'にコンマの位置移動

sen.j: 国風文化の発達により、着物の構造自体が大きく変わって袖丈が長くなったために、重要な役割を果たす着物となる。
sen.e: By growth of natively inspired art and culture, the structure of kimono itself changes largely, and sleeve length became longer. Accordingly, it became a kimono that served an important role.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処ここで言う「着物」は「袿」のことでしょうか。
sen.e: As Japanese culture developed, the design of kimonos changed greatly, with the sleeves becoming longer and uchiki came to serve an important role.
sen.cmt: Reworded
sen.e: As Japanese culture developed, the design of kimono changed greatly, with the sleeves becoming longer and uchiki came to serve an important role.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: その役割は襲で服装にアクセントを加えることであり、季節や状況によって様々なバリエーションが生まれた。
sen.e: Its role was to add an accent to costume with layers, and wide variations were created according to the seasons or occasions.
sen.cmt: 原文には (十二単…)とありますが、リンク先の単語のようです。ウェブで確認すると用語が「襲」となっており、本来はこちらの用語を使用していると思われますので、こちらを訳出しました。
sen.e: Its role was to accentuate costumes with layers of colors, and wide variations were created according to the seasons or the occasion.
sen.cmt: "add an accent to"→"accentuate"Added "of colors""occasion"→"the occasion"
sen.e: The role of uchiki was to accentuate costumes with layers of colors, and wide variations were created according to the seasons or the occasion.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 貴族の通常生活では小袖と袴の上に数枚の袿を重ねるのが平服であった。
sen.e: In their everyday life, nobles usually wore kosode (kimono with short sleeves) and hakama (pleated and divided skirt) under several layers of uchiki.
In their everyday life, nobles usually wore kosode (kimono with short sleeves) and hakama (pleated and divided skirt) under several layers of uchiki.
sen.cmt: OK
sen.e: In everyday life, nobles usually wore kosode (kimono with short sleeves) and hakama (pleated and divided skirt) under several layers of uchiki.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 一方、十二単を着るほどでもなく、平服でも失礼な場合の時に着用する着物として小袿なる物が発明される。
sen.e: Meanwhile, kouchigi was created for the occasions when juni-hitoe was too formal, yet everyday clothe might be impolite.
Meanwhile, kouchigi (literally "small uchigi) were created for occasions when juni-hitoe were too formal, yet everyday clothes might be impolite.
sen.cmt: "was"→"were"Added "(literally "small uchigi)"Deleted "the""was"→"were"Added 's'
sen.e: Meanwhile, kouchigi (literally "small uchigi") were created for occasions when juni-hitoe were too formal, but everyday clothes might be impolite.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 構造としては名前の通り「丈の短い袿」で、唐衣や表衣と同様に高価な織物から調製されるのを慣例とし、これを着用するときには裳をつけない。
sen.e: It was "short length uchiki", as it literally means, Like karaginu and uwagi, kouchigi was usually sewn with expensive fabric and it was worn without mo.

sen.e: As the name implies, these were short uchiki and like karaginu and uwagi, they were usually made of expensive fabric but were worn without a mo (a kind of stylized apron).

sen.e: As the name implies, these were short uchiki and like karaginu and uwagi, they were usually made of expensive fabric but were worn without a mo (a kind of stylized apron).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 高位の女性しか着用できない着物であった。
sen.e: It was a kimono that only a high-ranking woman could wear.

sen.cmt: "It was a kimono"→"They were garments"Deleted "a"Made "woman" plural
sen.e: They were garments that only high-ranking women could wear.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

The practice of wearing nakabe as described above started with kouchigi.

From the Kamakura period to the Edo period

sen.j: 天皇を中心とした中央集権の復活により、宮中に参内するときの服飾は袿を着用するよう定められた。
